nameAudio: R V nine two six romeo uniform

items.label2: 3 takeoffs and landings within the preceding 90 days for day or night
Are you sick or feeling under the weather? Do have any symptoms of an illness?
Are you on any medication that causes impairment and could interfere with your flight?
Are you under any stress or experiencing any anxiety that could negatively impact your ability to fly?
Have you consumed alcohol in the past 8 hours? Are you hungover?
Are you well rested? Have you slept enough? Or Are you too tired to fly?
Are you feeling angry or upset? Are you emotionally fit to go fly today?
Are crosswind below 10 KIAS at Departure & Arrival Airports?
Are runways greater than 2000 ft at Departure & Arrival Airports?
Do you have at least a Ceiling of 3000 feet & 3 statute miles of visibility?
Any passengers pressured to comeback on specific date & time? Are they aware of the potential delays inherent to flying on a small airplane?
Do you have a Alternate Flight Plan? Are Passengers briefed on diversion or cancellation plans and alternatives?
Credit card and telephone numbers available for alternate plans? Appropriate clothing or personal needs for alternate plans?

items.label1: If two or more areas of concern - don't go
Remember, accidents are a result of a chain of mistakes
Forecast departures and arrivals with 45 min to 1 hour contingency

items.label1: Starter cranking period should be limited to a maximum of 30 seconds, with at least 2 minutes between cranking periods.

items.label2Audio: 8 Quarts Keep level to 5.5 to 6.0 Quarts

items.label2: Each person must establish two-way radio communications with the ATC facility providing air traffic services prior to entering that airspace and thereafter maintain those communications while within that airspace.

From the primary airport or satellite airport with an operating control tower must establish and maintain two-way radio communications with the control tower, and thereafter as instructed by ATC while operating in the Class C airspace area

From a satellite airport without an operating control tower, must establish and maintain two-way radio communications with the ATC facility having jurisdiction over the Class C airspace area as soon as practicable after departing.
Class B airspace require a clearance from ATC. To receive the clearance, you need to "request clearance into the Class Bravo" from ATC prior to entering the airspace.

From the primary airport or satellite airport with an operating control tower must establish and maintain two-way radio communications with the control tower, and thereafter as instructed by ATC while operating in the Class B airspace area
